Ann_Arbor.State Theatre (Ann Arbor, Michigan):
The State Theatre is an operational former movie palace located at the intersection of State Street and Liberty Street in Ann Arbor, MI.
The theater's central location and distinctive green, yellow and red marquee have made it an icon of Ann Arbor's downtown.


== History ==
The theater was designed by architect C. Howard Crane, who had also designed the Fox Theatre (Detroit), and was built in 1942. The theater was owned and operated by the Butterfield Theater Company until 1985, when ownership was transferred to the George Kerasotes Corporation.
